div1.p: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON NORTHERN DIVISION.
Nick Mordevich, Plaintiff, vs. Joseph R. H. Jacoby, as Marshal of the above named District, Defendant.
No. 2139 ORDER SUSTAINING DEMURRER AND DENYING APPLICATION FOR WRIT.

This matter coming on for hearing in open court on this 29th day of April, 1912, on the application of the plaintiff herein for a writ of habeas corpus, and the defendant's demurrer thereto, plaintiff appearing by Fairchild and Bruce, and the defendant appearing by Elmer E. Todd, United States Attorney, and W.G. McLaren, Assistant United States Attorney, and after hearing argument of counsel herein;
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED, That said demurrer be, and the same is hereby sustained, and that said application for a writ of habeas corpus be, and the same is hereby denied.
IN THE District COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE Western District of Washington
Nick Mordevich, Plaintiff, vs. Joseph R.H. Jacoby, as Marshal of the above named District, Defendant.
ORDER SUSTAINING DEMURRER AND DENYING APPLICATION FOR WRIT
Filed April 30, 19 A.N. Engle, Clerk. By F. A. Snipkin Deputy.
